parse.title: List of cultural icons of Italy

This article's lead section does not adequately summarize key points of its contents. Please consider expanding the lead to provide an accessible overview of all important aspects of the article. Please discuss this issue on the article's talk page. (January 2014)
This article needs additional citations for verification. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. (January 2014) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)

The List of cultural icons of Italy is a list of links to potential cultural icons of Italy.[1][2]

Contents

  • 1 Art
  • 2 Buildings
  • 3 Dress and fashion
  • 4 Emblems
  • 5 Festivals, holidays
  • 6 Food and beverages
  • 7 History and legend
  • 8 Industry, science
  • 9 Literature, comics, press
  • 10 Music
  • 11 People
  • 12 Places
  • 13 Shopping, money
  • 14 Sport
  • 15 Television, radio, film, theatre
  • 16 Transport
  • 17 See also
  • 18 References

Art[edit]

  • Gian Lorenzo Bernini
  • Sandro Botticelli
  • Caravaggio
  • Donatello
  • Fra Angelico
  • Pietro Cascella[3]
  • Giorgio de Chirico
  • Giotto
  • Luciano Fabro[4]
  • Raphael
  • Leonardo da Vinci,[5][6][7] Mona Lisa
  • Michelangelo, David[8]
  • Tintoretto
  • Titian[9][10]

Buildings[edit]

  • Arena di Verona[11][12]
  • Basilica di Santa Maria del Fiore, Florence
  • Castel Nuovo, Naples
  • Colosseum[13][14]
  • Duomo di Milano
  • Faro di Genova
  • Grand Canal (Venice)
  • Mole Antonelliana, Turin
  • Palazzo Madama, Palazzo Montecitorio in Rome
  • Ponte Vecchio, Florence
  • St. Peter's Basilica, Vatican
  • Sistine Chapel, Vatican
  • Tower of Pisa[15]
  • Two Towers, Bologna

Dress and fashion[edit]

  • Armani[16]
  • Benetton
  • Roberto Cavalli
  • Dolce & Gabbana

Emblems[edit]

  • Flag of Italy, (Il Tricolore, bandiera italiana)
  • "Il Canto degli Italiani", (Inno di Mameli)
  • Italia Turrita, national personification of Italy
  • Emblem of Italy, emblem of Italy
  • Stella d’Italia, white star five tips that for many centuries represented the Italian land
  • Coccarda italiana tricolore, Italian tricolor cockade
  • Stendardo presidenziale italiano, banner of the President of Italy
  • Altare della Patria, Altar of the Motherland
  • Festa della Repubblica, the Italian National Day and Republic Day
  • Corbezzolo, national plant

  • Agriturismo
  • Calcio storico
  • Carnival of Venice
  • Ferragosto
  • Varia di Palmi, Palmi
  • Palio di Siena[21]
  • Regata Storica, Venice[22]
  • Sanremo Music Festival

Music[edit]

  • Vincenzo Bellini, Luciano Berio, Luigi Boccherini, Andrea Bocelli,[42] Ferruccio Busoni

  • 'O sole mio[45]

  • Umbria Jazz Festival

  • Adriatic Sea, Amalfi, Ancona, Aosta Valley, Apennine Mountains, Arezzo

  • Ravenna, Rimini, Rome

  • Trentino, Trento, Treviso, Trieste, Turin, Tuscany, Tyrrhenian Sea
  • Udine, Umbria
  • Veneto, Venice,[66][67][68] Verona, Vesuvius,[69] Vicenza
